subject: testing Exception Classes
msgSnippet: Hi, What would be the best way to test Exception Classes 1.      Use Test extends ExceptionTestCase. 2.      Use Test
messageBody:
Hi,

What would be the best way to test "Exception Classes"

1. Use <Source ClassName>Test extends ExceptionTestCase.

2. Use <Source ClassName>Test extends TestCase, and use an object which
throws these Exceptions, and force a throw.

3. Any other innovative approach?



Here is an Example:



public class AuditingException extends LocalizedException

{

//one of the constructors



public AuditingException(String msgKey, Object[] msgSubstitutions,

Throwable rootCause, Object exceptionThrower) {

super(msgKey, msgSubstitutions, rootCause,
exceptionThrower);

}

}



TEST:



public class AuditingExceptionTest extends TestCase

{

//instantiate the Exception

// Do a getException(); on the Exception object, and then do asserts

}



Thanks,

-Kamal.
